alert.note: Alert for Dawson; Franklin; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Kearney; Phelps; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 4:33PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A Quick Hit of Snow And/Or Blowing Snow Could Cause At Least Minor Travel Issues Into This Evening... Although these counties are not currently included in a formal Winter Weather Advisory due to the expectation that new snowfall accumulation has been or will be less than 1 inch, the combination of briefly-heavier bursts of snow and north winds gusting as high as around 40 MPH could still cause at least brief visibility reductions, slick roads and some blowing and drifting snow issues through at least 7 PM, including during the evening commute. All falling, accumulating snow has either already vacated the area or will end by 6 or 7 PM, but at least minor blowing snow issues could linger well into this evening before winds gradually subside overnight. Please be ready for rapidly changing, wintry weather conditions late this afternoon into this evening, despite the lack of a formal Winter Weather Advisory.

area.areaDesc: Dawson; Franklin; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Kearney; Phelps; Webster
